entities.Description: Markets where electricity, natural gas, and other energy commodities are bought and sold.
Agencies that promote and support the development and use of renewable energy sources.
Technologies that have been used for energy generation and distribution for a long time.
The use of less energy to provide the same level of output or service, resulting in reduced energy consumption, cost savings, and environmental benefits.
The process of capturing and storing energy for later use.

relations.Description: Blended finance mechanisms implement funding for sustainable energy projects.
relations.Subject: blended finance mechanisms

relations.Description: Blended finance mechanisms provide funding for renewable energy initiatives.
relations.Subject: blended finance mechanisms

relations.Description: Blended finance mechanisms focus on supporting the development and deployment of clean energy technologies.
relations.Subject: blended finance mechanisms

relations.Description: Blended finance mechanisms play a role in the sustainable energy sector.
relations.Subject: blended finance mechanisms

relations.Description: Blended finance mechanisms partner with private sector organizations to promote sustainable energy investments.
relations.Subject: blended finance mechanisms

relations.Description: Blended finance mechanisms contribute to improving energy access in underserved areas.
relations.Subject: blended finance mechanisms

relations.Description: Blended finance mechanisms monitor the progress and impact of sustainable energy projects.
relations.Subject: blended finance mechanisms

relations.Description: Blended finance mechanisms target increased deployment of renewable energy sources.
relations.Subject: blended finance mechanisms

relations.Description: Blended finance mechanisms address climate change mitigation through investments in sustainable energy.
relations.Subject: blended finance mechanisms
traditional energy technologies
relations.Description: Traditional energy technologies implement the Energy Efficiency Policy to promote the use of energy-saving designs and materials.

relations.Subject: traditional energy technologies
relations.Description: Traditional energy technologies provide funding for research in renewable energy sources.

relations.Subject: energy markets
relations.Description: Energy markets address the issue of energy access by ensuring the availability and affordability of energy sources for all segments of society.

relations.Subject: energy markets
relations.Description: Energy markets collaborate with government agencies to develop and implement policies and regulations that promote a sustainable and efficient energy sector.

relations.Subject: renewable energy agencies
relations.Description: Renewable energy agencies employ experts in the field of renewable energy to drive innovation and promote the adoption of clean energy technologies.

relations.Subject: renewable energy agencies
relations.Description: Renewable energy agencies collaborate with research institutions to advance scientific knowledge and develop new technologies for renewable energy generation.

relations.Subject: energy efficiency
relations.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

relations.Subject: renewable energy agencies
relations.Description: Renewable energy agencies employ experts in the field of renewable energy to drive innovation and promote the adoption of clean energy technologies.

relations.Subject: clean cooking
relations.Description: Clean cooking implements energy efficiency policies that promote the use of clean and efficient cooking technologies.

relations.Subject: energy poverty indices
relations.Description: Energy poverty indices implement energy access programs to provide affordable and reliable energy services to underserved communities.

Concessional finance is a type of financial support provided at more favorable terms, such as lower interest rates or longer repayment periods, to promote sustainable development projects. It is often used in blended finance mechanisms to attract private sector investment.
relations.Subject: concessional finance

relations.Description: Guarantees are financial instruments that provide a form of insurance or risk mitigation to investors in blended finance mechanisms. They help reduce the perceived risk of investing in sustainable energy projects, thereby attracting more private sector capital.
relations.Subject: guarantees

relations.Description: Blended finance platforms are specialized financial intermediaries that facilitate the structuring and coordination of blended finance transactions. They play a crucial role in mobilizing and channeling funds from different sources to support sustainable energy projects.
relations.Subject: blended finance platforms

relations.Description: Debt-for-nature swaps are financial arrangements where a portion of a country's debt is forgiven or restructured in exchange for investments in conservation or sustainable development projects. They are a form of blended finance mechanism that promotes both environmental and economic goals.
relations.Subject: debt-for-nature swaps

relations.Description: Impact investing refers to investments made with the intention of generating positive social and environmental impact, alongside financial returns. It is often used as a component of blended finance mechanisms to attract private sector capital for sustainable energy projects.
relations.Subject: impact investing
